devela/sys/env/
namespace.rs

1// devela::sys::env::env
2//
3//! Defines the [`Env`] struct namespace.
4//
5// TOC
6// - Constants
7// - Command line arguments
8// - Environment variables
9// - Paths
10
11#[cfg(all(feature = "std", feature = "unsafe_thread"))]
12use crate::_dep::_std::env::{remove_var, set_var};
13#[allow(deprecated, reason = "WAIT for official undeprecation of home_dir")]
14#[cfg(feature = "std")]
15use crate::{
16    _dep::_std::env::{
17        args, args_os, current_dir, current_exe, home_dir, join_paths, set_current_dir,
18        split_paths, temp_dir, var, var_os, vars, vars_os,
19    },
20    IoResult, IterArgs, IterArgsOs, IterSplitPaths, IterVars, IterVarsOs, JoinPathsError, OsStr,
21    OsString, Path, PathBuf, VarError,
22};
23#[cfg_attr(not(feature = "__force_miri_dst"), cfg(not(miri)))]
24#[cfg(all(feature = "std", feature = "unsafe_ffi"))]
25use crate::{IterArgsOsRef, args_os_ref_iter};
26
27#[doc = crate::TAG_NAMESPACE!()]
28/// A namespaced wrapper for `std::env` functions and constants.
29#[derive(Debug)]
30pub struct Env;
31
32/// # Constants
33/*
34NOTE: The lists of expected values for not(std) configuration flags can be copied from:
35<https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/tests/ui/check-cfg/well-known-values.stderr>.
36Afterwards they can be procesed with vim commands similar to:
37s/`//g
38s/, /\r/g
39s/\([a-z0-9_.]\+\)/#[cfg(target_arch = "\1")]\r{ "\1" }/
40s/\([a-z0-9_.]\+\)/target_arch = "\1",/
41*/
42impl Env {
43    #[doc = crate::TAG_MAYBE_STD!()]
44    /// A string describing the architecture of the CPU that is currently in use.
45    ///
46    /// Expected values are:
47    /// `aarch64`, `arm`, `arm64ec`, `avr`, `bpf`, `csky`, `hexagon`, `loongarch64`, `m68k`, `mips`, `mips32r6`, `mips64`, `mips64r6`, `msp430`, `nvptx64`, `powerpc`, `powerpc64`, `riscv32`, `riscv64`, `s390x`, `sparc`, `sparc64`, `unknown`, `wasm32`, `wasm64`, `x86`, `x86_64`, and `xtensa`.
48    #[rustfmt::skip]
49    pub const ARCH: &'static str = {
50        #[cfg(feature = "std")]
51        { ::std::env::consts::ARCH }
52        #[cfg(not(feature = "std"))]
53        { // 28 arches:
54            #[cfg(target_arch = "aarch64")]
55            { "aarch64" }
56            #[cfg(target_arch = "amdgpu")]
57            { "amdgpu" }
58            #[cfg(target_arch = "arm")]
59            { "arm" }
60            #[cfg(target_arch = "arm64ec")]
61            { "arm64ec" }
62            #[cfg(target_arch = "avr")]
63            { "avr" }
64            #[cfg(target_arch = "bpf")]
65            { "bpf" }
66            #[cfg(target_arch = "csky")]
67            { "csky" }
68            #[cfg(target_arch = "hexagon")]
69            { "hexagon" }
70            #[cfg(target_arch = "loongarch64")]
71            { "loongarch64" }
72            #[cfg(target_arch = "m68k")]
73            { "m68k" }
74            #[cfg(target_arch = "mips")]
75            { "mips" }
76            #[cfg(target_arch = "mips32r6")]
77            { "mips32r6" }
78            #[cfg(target_arch = "mips64")]
79            { "mips64" }
80            #[cfg(target_arch = "mips64r6")]
81            { "mips64r6" }
82            #[cfg(target_arch = "msp430")]
83            { "msp430" }
84            #[cfg(target_arch = "nvptx64")]
85            { "nvptx64" }
86            #[cfg(target_arch = "powerpc")]
87            { "powerpc" }
88            #[cfg(target_arch = "powerpc64")]
89            { "powerpc64" }
90            #[cfg(target_arch = "riscv32")]
91            { "riscv32" }
92            #[cfg(target_arch = "riscv64")]
93            { "riscv64" }
94            #[cfg(target_arch = "s390x")]
95            { "s390x" }
96            #[cfg(target_arch = "sparc")]
97            { "sparc" }
98            #[cfg(target_arch = "sparc64")]
99            { "sparc64" }
100            #[cfg(target_arch = "wasm32")]
101            { "wasm32" }
102            #[cfg(target_arch = "wasm64")]
103            { "wasm64" }
104            #[cfg(target_arch = "x86")]
105            { "x86" }
106            #[cfg(target_arch = "x86_64")]
107            { "x86_64" }
108            #[cfg(target_arch = "xtensa")]
109            { "xtensa" }
110            #[cfg(not(any(
111                target_arch = "aarch64",
112                target_arch = "amdgpu",
113                target_arch = "arm",
114                target_arch = "arm64ec",
115                target_arch = "avr",
116                target_arch = "bpf",
117                target_arch = "csky",
118                target_arch = "hexagon",
119                target_arch = "loongarch64",
120                target_arch = "m68k",
121                target_arch = "mips",
122                target_arch = "mips32r6",
123                target_arch = "mips64",
124                target_arch = "mips64r6",
125                target_arch = "msp430",
126                target_arch = "nvptx64",
127                target_arch = "powerpc",
128                target_arch = "powerpc64",
129                target_arch = "riscv32",
130                target_arch = "riscv64",
131                target_arch = "s390x",
132                target_arch = "sparc",
133                target_arch = "sparc64",
134                target_arch = "wasm32",
135                target_arch = "wasm64",
136                target_arch = "x86",
137                target_arch = "x86_64",
138                target_arch = "xtensa",
139            )))]
140            { "unknown" }
141        }
142    };
143
144    #[doc = crate::TAG_MAYBE_STD!()]
145    /// The family of the operating system.
146    ///
147    /// The expected values are: `unix`, `unknown`, `wasm` and `windows`.
148    #[rustfmt::skip]
149    pub const FAMILY: &'static str = {
150        #[cfg(feature = "std")]
151        { ::std::env::consts::FAMILY }
152        #[cfg(not(feature = "std"))]
153        {
154            #[cfg(target_family = "unix")]
155            { "unix" }
156            #[cfg(target_family = "wasm")]
157            { "wasm" }
158            #[cfg(target_family = "windows")]
159            { "windows" }
160            #[cfg(not(any(
161                target_family = "unix",
162                target_family = "wasm",
163                target_family = "windows",
164            )))]
165            { "unknown" }
166        }
167    };
168
169    /// A string describing the vendor of the CPU that is currently in use.
170    ///
171    /// Expected values are:
172    ///  `amd`, `apple`, `espressif`, `fortanix`, `ibm`, `kmc`, `mti`, `nintendo`, `nvidia`, `openwrt`, `pc`, `risc0`, `sony`, `sun`, `unikraft`, `unknown`, `uwp`, `vex`, `win7`, and `wrs`.

236
237    #[doc = crate::TAG_MAYBE_STD!()]
238    /// A string describing the specific operating system in use.
239    ///
240    /// The expected values are:
241    /// `aix`, `android`, `cuda`, `cygwin`, `dragonfly`, `emscripten`, `espidf`, `freebsd`, `fuchsia`, `haiku`, `hermit`, `horizon`, `hurd`, `illumos`, `ios`, `l4re`, `linux`, `macos`, `netbsd`, `none`, `nto`, `nuttx`, `openbsd`, `psp`, `psx`, `redox`, `rtems`, `solaris`, `solid_asp3`, `teeos`, `trusty`, `tvos`, `uefi`, `unknown`, `visionos`, `vita`, `vxworks`, `wasi`, `watchos`, `windows`, `xous`, and `zkvm`.
242    #[rustfmt::skip]

379
380    /// Specifies the file extension used for shared libraries on this platform
381    /// that goes after the dot.
382    ///
383    /// Some possible values:
384    /// - `so`
385    /// - `dylib`
386    /// - `dll`
387    #[cfg(feature = "std")]
388    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
389    pub const DLL_EXTENSION: &'static str = ::std::env::consts::DLL_EXTENSION;
390
391    /// Specifies the filename prefix used for shared libraries on this platform.
392    ///
393    /// Some possible values:
394    /// - `lib`
395    /// - `` (an empty string)
396    #[cfg(feature = "std")]
397    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
398    pub const DLL_PREFIX: &'static str = ::std::env::consts::DLL_PREFIX;
399
400    /// Specifies the filename suffix used for shared libraries on this platform.
401    ///
402    /// Some possible values:
403    /// - `.so`
404    /// - `.dylib`
405    /// - `.dll`
406    #[cfg(feature = "std")]
407    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
408    pub const DLL_SUFFIX: &'static str = ::std::env::consts::DLL_SUFFIX;
409
410    /// Specifies the file extension, if any, used for executable binaries on this platform.
411    ///
412    /// Some possible values:
413    /// - `exe`
414    /// - `` (an empty string)
415    #[cfg(feature = "std")]
416    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
417    pub const EXE_EXTENSION: &'static str = ::std::env::consts::EXE_EXTENSION;
418
419    /// Specifies the filename suffix used for executable binaries on this platform.
420    ///
421    /// Some possible values:
422    /// - `.exe`
423    /// - `.nexe`
424    /// - `.pexe`
425    /// - `` (an empty string)
426    #[cfg(feature = "std")]
427    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
428    pub const EXE_SUFFIX: &'static str = ::std::env::consts::EXE_SUFFIX;
429}
430
431/// # Command line arguments
432#[cfg(feature = "std")]
433#[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
434impl Env {
435    /// Returns the arguments that this program was started with.
436    ///
437    /// See [args].
438    #[inline(always)]
439    pub fn args() -> IterArgs {
440        args()
441    }
442
443    /// See [args_os].
444    #[inline(always)]
445    pub fn args_os() -> IterArgsOs {
446        args_os()
447    }
448
449    #[doc = crate::_doc_miri_warn!(tag)]
450    #[cfg_attr(not(feature = "__force_miri_dst"), cfg(not(miri)))]
451    /// Command line arguments by reference: `Iterator<Item = &'static OsStr>`.
452    #[doc = crate::_doc!(vendor: "argv")]
453    #[cfg(all(feature = "std", feature = "unsafe_ffi"))]
454    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(all(feature = "std", feature = "unsafe_ffi"))))]
455    pub fn args_os_ref() -> IterArgsOsRef {
456        args_os_ref_iter()
457    }
458}
459
460/// # Environment variables
461#[cfg(feature = "std")]
462#[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
463impl Env {
464    /// Fetches the environment variable key from the current process.
465    ///
466    /// See [var].
467    pub fn var<K: AsRef<OsStr>>(key: K) -> Result<String, VarError> {
468        var(key)
469    }
470
471    /// Returns an iterator of (variable, value) pairs of strings,
472    /// for all the environment variables of the current process.
473    ///
474    /// See [vars].
475    pub fn vars() -> IterVars {
476        vars()
477    }
478
479    /// Fetches the environment variable key from the current process.
480    ///
481    /// See [var_os].
482    pub fn var_os<K: AsRef<OsStr>>(key: K) -> Option<OsString> {
483        var_os(key)
484    }
485
486    /// Returns an iterator of (variable, value) pairs of OS strings,
487    /// for all the environment variables of the current process.
488    ///
489    /// See [vars_os].
490    pub fn vars_os() -> IterVarsOs {
491        vars_os()
492    }
493
494    /// Removes the environment variable `key` from the environment
495    /// of the currently running process.
496    ///
497    /// # Safety
498    /// See [remove_var].
499    #[cfg(all(not(feature = "safe_sys"), feature = "unsafe_thread"))]
500    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "unsafe_thread")))]
501    pub unsafe fn remove_var<K: AsRef<OsStr>>(key: K) {
502        unsafe { remove_var(key) }
503    }
504
505    /// Sets the environment variable `key` to the value `value`
506    /// for the currently running process.
507    ///
508    /// # Safety
509    /// See [set_var].
510    #[cfg(all(not(feature = "safe_sys"), feature = "unsafe_thread"))]
511    #[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "unsafe_thread")))]
512    pub unsafe fn set_var<K: AsRef<OsStr>, V: AsRef<OsStr>>(key: K, value: V) {
513        unsafe { set_var(key, value) }
514    }
515}
516
517/// # Paths
518#[cfg(feature = "std")]
519#[cfg_attr(nightly_doc, doc(cfg(feature = "std")))]
520impl Env {
521    /// Returns the full filesystem path of the current running executable.
522    ///
523    /// See [current_exe].
524    pub fn current_exe() -> IoResult<PathBuf> {
525        current_exe()
526    }
527
528    /// Returns the current working directory.
529    ///
530    /// See [current_dir].
531    pub fn current_dir() -> IoResult<PathBuf> {
532        current_dir()
533    }
534
535    /// Changes the current working directory to the specified path.
536    ///
537    /// See [set_current_dir].
538    pub fn set_current_dir<P: AsRef<Path>>(path: P) -> IoResult<()> {
539        set_current_dir(path)
540    }
541
542    /// Returns the path of the current users home directory if known.
543    ///
544    /// See [home_dir].
545    #[allow(deprecated, reason = "WAIT for official undeprecation")]
546    pub fn home_dir() -> Option<PathBuf> {
547        home_dir()
548    }
549
550    /// Returns the path of a temporary directory.
551    ///
552    /// See [temp_dir].
553    pub fn temp_dir() -> PathBuf {
554        temp_dir()
555    }
556
557    /// Joins a collection of [Path]s appropriately for the `PATH` environment variable.
558    ///
559    /// See [join_paths].
560    pub fn join_paths<I, T>(paths: I) -> Result<OsString, JoinPathsError>
561    where
562        I: IntoIterator<Item = T>,
563        T: AsRef<OsStr>,
564    {
565        join_paths(paths)
566    }
567
568    /// Parses input according to platform conventions for the `PATH` environment variable.
569    ///
570    /// See [split_paths].
571    pub fn split_paths<T: AsRef<OsStr> + ?Sized>(unparsed: &T) -> IterSplitPaths<'_> {
572        split_paths(unparsed)
573    }
574}
